intro: Oxypetalum erectum var. genuinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, while its flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. It is often used in ornamental horticulture for its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to shaded garden environments.
